description:
Site Visit - Studio of Pacific Architecture - Te Aro Double-Header!, Join us on Wednesday 20 August, for an exclusive NAWIC members-only site tour of two very different but geographically close projects in Te Aro. The National War Memorial and FPC Martin Square are both undergoing major refurbishment - join us for a look behind the scenes!
National War Memorial: Refurbishing a Wellington Icon
Step behind the scaffolding and witness the National War Memorial Project – a complex seismic strengthening project where heritage sensitivity is of utmost importance. With construction works being carried out by Maycroft Construction, join us for the rare opportunity to explore a significant piece of the capital’s cultural fabric.
Known to many as the backdrop of ANZAC Day commemorations, this national memorial is undergoing a meticulous refurbishment to ensure its legacy endures for generations to come.
 What’s Happening On Site:
Seismic strengthening of the tower and bell frame 
Stone remediation to preserve its historic façade
Asphalt roofing works
The real challenge? Balancing modern engineering with heritage preservation. Every upgrade is being carried out with deep respect for the building’s historical significance.

Then, just around the corner, we will move on to another refurbishment project – at a much different scale and for a very different purpose!
 FPC Martin Square: from Workshop to Office Space
Leading industrial design-and-build specialists First Principles Constructors are celebrating seven years of innovation with a bold move - into a brand-new headquarters in central Wellington. Take a look inside the transformation of a former engineering workshop into the new HQ for FPC. With exposed services, raw materials, and an industrial aesthetic, this compact yet clever refurbishment shows how much can be achieved in a small urban footprint. Construction is well underway by Aoraki Construction, with completion coming up in September.
What’s Happening On Site:
•     Structural steel installation, new roofing, cladding, a new concrete mezzanine slab
•     Interior fit-out works
•     Full building services upgrades
 The Details:
🕒 DATE and TIME: Wednesday, 20th August, meet at 2.45pm for a 3.00pm start at the National War Memorial
📍 LOCATION: Meet at the National War Memorial (19 Buckle Street) to explore this site first. We will then walk over to 21 Martin Square as a group, for the next site visit.
🎟️ COST: Free to NAWIC members, with a maximum of 18 people on the tour, so please book your space consciously. Get in quick! You can join NAWIC here.
👷‍♀️PPE: Hard hat, hi-vis, steel-capped boots. (Spare hard-hats/hi-vis are available if required, please make sure you advise us of what you need on your RSVP.)
 🎉 After the site visits, unwind with drinks and nibbles sponsored by First Principles Constructors at a nearby venue (TBC) – a chance to connect, reflect, and chat all things design and construction.
🧡 Huge thanks to Studio of Pacific Architecture, Aoraki Construction, Maycroft Construction, and First Principles Constructors for teaming up to make this event possible.
Please note: NAWIC is a voluntary organisation, committed to its obligations as a PCBU under the Health and Safety at Work Act 2015.   Amongst other things, this requires NAWIC to take all practicable steps to eliminate, isolate or minimize hazards that our event attendees are exposed to. Health and safety is a shared responsibility.

description:
FULLY BOOKED - Family Shiny - Akatarawa Forestt, Registrations open NOW
What to expect
This is a “Family Shiny” trip into the Akatarawa Forest.
Non members are welcome to join us but must register to obtain details of start time and location.
Vehicles must have a low ratio gearbox and must not be a 4wd car, station wagon or van, and if a soft top must have a roll cage.
Visitor Registration- $20.00 per driver
There is no trip fee for this trip however non-members pay a “Day Membership Fee” of $20. This is payable in Cash to the Trip Leader on the day.
The trip should be relatively easy as it needs to cater for people just starting out and all types of 4wd vehicles – but a good way to see if you want to get into 4wding and a chance to meet some of our club members (if you are unsure if your vehicle is suitable just ask).
No Dogs Allowed sorry
Once you have completed 3 Family Shinys you can join the club but can only participate in Family Shiny or Touring Class trips. Once you have also done a Training Day and had your vehicle inspected by one of our approved inspectors you can come along on our other more adventurous trips. To find out more on how to join our club go to https://ccvcwellington.wildapricot.org/page-1725861.
Like our Facebook page to find out about more trips and club nights.
label: Other

description:
Lawrence Arabia Is Playing A Solo Show, It’s been six years since he last released an album and, like Richard Prebble before him, Lawrence Arabia’s been thinking.
When songwriters think, often the result is songs. It’s time to bring out some of these new thought babies from the writing suite and expose them to the light; let them photosynthesise and become real and alive in the world.
The Silver Scroll, Taite and Tūī winning artist brings his engaging show of (new and old) songs and talk, accompanied by guitar and keys, to Meow.
With support from Frances Grass.

description:
Club Night - Fireside Chat with Mark and Gavin, it's all about the punt!, Ever wondered what’s really involved in lifting your chains, checking your blocks, and keeping your boat secure inside the harbour?
Come along and hear Gavin and Mark share their knowledge — including Gavin’s tale of installing blocks for Revenue Cutter inside the boat harbour, and how a “mooring muscle boy” became a rocket!
You’ll learn:
How to inspect chains and spot potential issues
Why regular servicing (every 2 years) is the best protection in heavy winds
The story of the Punt — over 100 years old and still servicing moorings in Clyde Quay
The Mooring Punt isn’t a dark art — it’s a simple winch with rollers that does an important job. This is your chance to see how it works, ask questions, and even book a slot to have your mooring serviced so you can sleep well knowing your boat is secure.

description:
Toi Pōneke Market Lane Tours: CANCELLED, We’re excited to announce tours of the new Toi Pōneke whare at 3-6 Market Lane, Wellington. We will be occupying a portion of the building on the corner of Cable Street and Market Lane.

Before our new premises undergo a refit, we invite you to tour the interior of the building and see where the artist studios, arts offices and workshop space will be located.

Tours are available on Sat 30 Aug '25 at 11am, 12noon, 1pm and 2pm and Sun 31 Aug '25 at 10am, 11am, 12noon, and 1pm.

The re-imagined Toi Pōneke Moemoeā (Vision) is:
He kaiwhakatere i te tupu me te whanaketanga o ngā ringatoi o Te Whanganui-a-Tara

A catalyst for the growth and development of Wellington artists

Our new Toi Pōneke will create a vibrant space that nurtures collaboration, creativity and cultural exchange among artists of all generations using Tuakana-Teina Kaupapa. 

For more information head to the Toi Pōneke website.

description:
Lacuna Presents - Us Two tickets, Presented by: Lacuna
Us Two is a high-energy house DJ act from the Midlands, UK, with releases on some of the world's most respected labels including Knee Deep In Sound, MicroHertz, and Eastenderz. Known for deep grooves, rolling basslines, and infectious crowd connection, Us Two has earned support from global heavyweights like Marco Carola, Jamie Jones, and Skream.
From European festival stages to Ibiza's 528 for a standout set with Knee Deep In Sound, Us Two's sound blends underground credibility with dancefloor-ready energy.
His latest release, "Simulation" (featuring Franksy), drops on Pete Tong's TSZR label, and has already earned plays from tastemakers like ANOTR, SG Lewis, LF SYSTEM, and SOSA, with early reactions going wild at Music On (Pacha Ibiza) and beyond.
For Lacuna, hosting Us Two’s debut in Wellington is about more than a headline — it's personal. We're thrilled to finally bring a dear friend's sound to our city and invite you to feel the energy first-hand on Saturday, 20 September 2025, at Meow Nui.
Packages

Jonathan Crayford keys, Joe Kaptein keys, Riki Pirihi drums, Julien Dyne drums.

description:
Quintessential Quiz for Kaibosh! Mövenpick Hotel Wellington, Gather your friends for a great night out in support of Kaibosh at the beautiful Mövenpick Hotel Wellington in partnership with SKÅL Wellington.
If you're a fan of our Kaibosh Quiz Night for Cheats of the past, the Quintessential Quiz is still for cheats - a glammed-up version!
DATE: Thursday 4 September
TIME: Doors open: 6:00 PM
Quiz starts: 6:30 PM sharp
VENUE: Mövenpick Hotel Wellington, 345 The Terrace (venue generously donated by Mövenpick)
HOST: The evening's MC will be the incredible Erin Rush, VP of NZ Rugby and former Black Fern.
Great prizes for top teams. Awesome raffle prizes to be won

Come along for quizzical fun and fundraising - with all proceeds from the quiz going direct to Kaibosh to help us provide healthy, rescued food to people in need in the Wellington region.
HOW TO ENTER
Teams of 4
$120 per table
Limited tables available – book early via Humanitix! Hit the ticket booking link above
https://events.humanitix.com/quintessential-quiz-for...
Don't worry if you don't have a team yet, we can connect you with others on the night. You can buy an individual ticket at $35.00 pp.
WHAT TO EXPECT - QUIZ FOR CHEATS

Five rounds of 10 questions
Choose your bonus round – earn double points!
It’s a Quiz for Cheats – so you can buy up to 6 correct answers to boost your score!
FOOD & DRINK
Delicious food and drink will be available to purchase throughout the evening.
LOCATION & PARKING
Mövenpick Hotel Wellington is at 345 The Terrace.
There is very limited street parking.
label: Other

description:
DRAG BINGO with Homer Neurotic @ Dirty Little Secret, This is not your grandma’s bingo night. Wellington’s resident sad boy and pint-sized powerhouse, Homer Neurotic, is taking over the rooftop at Dirty Little Secret for a night of unhinged chaos, cocktails, and camp realness.
Get ready for an evening dripping in glamour, glitter, and glorious nonsense as you soak up the skyline views from one of the capital’s most iconic rooftop hideaways.
What to expect:
• Free entry, all you need is a table booking and good vibes
• Over $200 worth of prizes, including a $100 bar voucher for the grand winner
• Spot prizes, cheeky antics, and bad decisions encouraged
• Live drag performances that’ll leave you confused, flustered, and deeply entertained
• Dad jokes, dance-offs, and plenty of double entendres
• Drink and kai specials to keep you going
• After the Bingo stick around to boogie down with one of the resident DJ’s, spinning your tracks all night long
Bookings essential:
Tables available from 7.00 pm with balls dropping no later than 7.30. Walk-ins are very limited so grab your spot now:
https://dirtylittlesecret.co.nz/events/drag-bingo/
Safe and inclusive:
Dirty Little Secret is proudly LGBTQIA+ friendly. Our staff and security are trained to make everyone feel welcome and safe. Elevator access is available, but some tables are on raised flooring, so please reach out if you have accessibility needs and we’ll make sure you’re well looked after.
Heads up:
This is an R18 event. Expect colourful language, cheeky antics, and wholesome masculinity served with a side of mischief. Consider yourself warned.
Follow me for more nonsense:
Find me on Instagram at @homerneurotic for a peek behind the scenes and more of the drama, glitter and tears.
label: Other

Playing a mix of standards and originals, you’ll hear the music of Ornette Coleman, Mark Lockett, Steve Grossman, and Isaac Randel.

description:
Spring Floral Display Accessible Self-Drive Tour, Gather your friends, whānau, or neighbours who might find it tricky to access the gardens, and enjoy a relaxing, self-guided drive through a spectacular spring floral display at Wellington Botanic Garden ki Paekākā.

Simply drive along the one-way route past the Display Garden and soak in the colours of tulips, forget-me-nots, dianthus, primulas, chrysanthemums, daffodils, and more.

How it works:
- No registration needed — just turn up and enter through the Glenmore Street gates.
- Follow the designated one-way route through the gardens, keeping within your vehicle at all times.
- Exit through the West/White Gate to return to Glenmore Street.
- Feel free to enjoy the route as many times as you like during opening hours.

Please note:
- Drive slowly (maximum 10 km/h), and watch carefully for pedestrians, especially children.
- Stay in your vehicle for the entire tour to keep everyone safe and comfortable.
- Follow all signage and do not turn around within the garden grounds.

This event is self-guided and unstaffed. If you need assistance during your visit, please call 04 499 1400.
For enquiries, email treehouse@wcc.govt.nz or call 04 499 1400.
label: Other

description:
Box of Birds, Hailed as "the cutest little show in Aotearoa" (Hamilton Arts Festival 2024), award-winning theatre company Birdlife Productions have created this gorgeous theatre show designed especially for ages 4 to 9 years, Including exquisite puppetry, live interactive songs, projection and the teaching of a waiata, this work reflects our transformative connection to nature. Peter is reluctant to stay with nanna in the school holidays because she lives in the country and doesn't have a TV but Nanna finds ways to engage Peter in her love of the forest, especially the precious manu, when they build a nesting box for Ruru together. Peter is excited to see if Ruru will make her home in the box, waiting patiently while many other birds arrive to check out the box first! And after all that waiting, Nanna takes Peter on an exciting night time forest walk to find Ruru - in the dark! The bird characters are all familiar New Zealand locals, such as piwakawaka, kereru, tui and ruru, and the story highlights the importance of supporting them and the different needs they may have. Teachers and Parents have been ecstatic about this show and hundreds of New Zealand children have been transfixed by it.
As quoted by Theatreview: “This is truly a New Zealand show for New Zealand children and all those young-at-heart”.
label: Other

description:
MESSIE - Wellington, MESSIE is taking Aotearoa’s electronic dance music scene to filthy new levels. As a former drummer, her passion for drumming was the pipeline for her falling in love with genres like Garage, Breakbeat, and Jungle. She has since expanded her sound and it’s safe to say each set will keep you guessing what will come next as she effortlessly merges genres such as Baile Funk, Ghetto Tech, Jersey Club, Juke, Afro beat inspired drums, Techno and many more global club soundscapes that encompass her high energy DJ sets. MESSIE’s sets are guaranteed to be bootleg heavy with something for everyone as she draws from her own music taste of rap and grime, to early 2000’s singalongs, girl-boss anthems and queer music culture in the form of edits you’d never expect.

Alongside her headline tour around Aotearoa in mid 2024, MESSIE has now brought her fresh, high-energy club music to Glastonbury, Reading & Leeds, R&V, Beyond The Valley, Wildlands, Love Saves The Day, Gemfest & Outro Festival. With slots at Pohoda Festival, Hidden Festival, Motion, Truck Festival, AIASOUND and All Points East locked in for the second half of 2025, there is no slowing her down.
label: Other

description:
The Night is Always Darkest, From the makers of Don't Wake Me Up and One Night Band, The Night is Always Darkest returns after a soldout season at NZ Fringe!

Spend a night with Lia as she fills the sleepless hours of the morning in real-time. Get to know her and influence her decisions in this award-nominated durational theatre experience.

Attend the show live at Two/Fifty Seven Willis Street or tune into our live streams on Twitch and YouTube. Show starts at 11:59pm on Saturday 20th September and runs for 7 hours.

“an incredibly audacious show.”- Theatreview
“a vital theatrical experience.”- Theatreview

Finalist- Most Innovative Work, NZ Fringe 2025

Created by
Lia Kelly
Izzi Lao
Rosie Glover
Austin Harrison
Campbell Wright
label: Other
